programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 13 Texas Tech (18-4, 9-2) won seven-straight games, including a 70-54 win over the Wildcats on Jan. 18 behind 20 points and 16 rebounds from JT Toppin; No. 20 Arizona (16-6, 10-1) won five straight since the loss to the Red Raiders.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Duke (20-2, 12-0) won 16 straight behind Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC in scoring with 19.2 ppg, and won eight of the last 10 meetings with the Tigers after a 72-71 win last season; Clemson (17-4, 9-1) is 11-2 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 3 Alabama (19-3, 8-1) won five-straight games, and is the top scoring offense in the country, averaging 90.2 ppg behind Mark Sears, who is tied for second in the SEC with 18.1 ppg; Arkansas (14-8, 3-6) won two straight, and is 9-3 at home.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: South Carolina claimed a 67-50 victory over Texas in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 12, led by 22 combined points from Te-Hina Paopao and Chloe Kitts; Kyla Oldacre posted 11 points and 16 rebounds for the Longhorns in the road loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Boston claimed a 132-109 victory over New York in their first meeting of the season on Oct. 22, led by a 37point, 10-assist performance from Jayson Tatum; Derrick White added 24 points and 4 assists for the Celtics in the win at home.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Mary's (20-4, 10-1) had its 10-game winning streak snapped by San Francisco, 65-64, despite 20 points from Augustas Marciulionis; Oregon State (17-7, 7-4) is 14-1 at home this season behind Michael Rataj, who is third in the WCC with 17.9 ppg.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The most memorable games throughout the history of the NFL are replayed, reliving some of the marquee matchups on the biggest stages, impressive performances from the biggest names in the sport, unbelievable comebacks and playoff classics.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: BYU (15-7, 6-5) won four of its last five games, including an 80-52 win over the Bearcats on Jan. 25 behind 21 points from Richie Saunders and 15 from Egor Demin; Cincinnati (13-9, 3-8) ended a four-game skid with a 93-83 win over UCF.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Temple (14-9, 6-4) is 4-9 away from home, but defeated the Tigers, 88-81, on Jan. 16 behind 21 points from Jamal Mashburn Jr., who leads the AAC in scoring with 22.1 ppg; No. 17 Memphis (19-4, 9-1) won six straight behind PJ Haggerty.

programme.title: UFC 312: Du Plessis vs. Strickland 2 (Prelims)
programme.desc: Scheduled UFC 312 preliminary bouts: Jack Jenkins (13-3) vs. Gabriel Santos (11-2) in a featherweight bout; Tom Nolan (8-1) vs. Viacheslav Borshchev (8-4-1) in a lightweight bout; Wang Cong (6-1) vs. Bruna Brasil (10-4-1) in a flyweight bout.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Once regarded as one of the most recognizable Chiefs superfans, Xaviar "ChiefsAholic" Babudar had a much different persona underneath the wolf suit he would wear to games after news broke of his criminal bank robberies across seven states.

programme.title: ACL Kickoff Battle
programme.desc: Cornhole consists of throwing beanbags at a slanted board with a hole near the top, attempting to reach 21 points before an opponent; league consists of competitive tournaments for the professional, collegiate, and youth divisions.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: Detailed analysis of coaching strategies for upcoming games in the National Football League; experts use the coaches' film to illustrate effective and ineffective strategies for the various matchups and provide an in-depth breakdown of potential game

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.desc: A New York City DJ would change the culture of basketball in the late 1990s after putting music behind streetball highlights, creating the And1 Mixtape series to give a unique and entertaining perspective to a rarely-seen brand of basketball.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between Bill Parcells and Bill Belichick is traced over four decades; Parcells and Belichick first worked together as assistants with the New York Giants and have forged a bond that few men of their stature have ever experienced.

programme.desc: Stanford claimed a 78-63 victory over Louisville in their most recent meeting in the Elite Eight on March 31, 2021, led by 21 points and 9 rebounds from Lexie Hull; Dana Evans posted 24 points and 3 assists for the Cardinals in the postseason defeat.

programme.title: Abdullah Mason: Appetite for Smoke
programme.desc: One of the top up-and-coming lightweight boxers, Abdullah Mason uses an entertaining boxing style to start his career undefeated and pursuing more, bigger names as he looks to add a title to his accolades in becoming a household name.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Ole Miss claimed a 75-45 victory over Kentucky in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season, led by 16 points and 6 assists from Madison Scott; Amiya Jenkins and Saniah Tyler both had 10 points for the Wildcats in the defeat at home.

programme.title: UFC Archival PPV
programme.desc: Alex Pereira (9-2) defends his lightweight championship against Jamahal Hill (12-1) in the main event; Zhang Weili (24-3) defends her strawweight title against Yan Xiaonan (17-3); Justin Gaethje (26-4) defends his BMF title vs. Max Holloway (25-7).

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: Wooden Award Late Season Top 20 Special
programme.desc: The 20 contenders still competing for the illustrious Wooden Award are revealed, showcasing highlights from some of their biggest performances of the season, along with statistical analysis to exemplify why they deserve the recognition.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: NFL insider Field Yates reveals his latest mock for the 2025 NFL Draft before the actual draft, going over who they think will be heading to each team, the players that are rising and falling, and the sleepers to sneak into the first round.

programme.desc: The cultural importance of sports is examined through the exploration of various athletes' journeys through life, both on and off the field, including the challenges, change and unity that sports are able to bring to different communities.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Each bowler in the eight-player field will have two minutes to throw as many strikes as possible with the player with the most strikes advancing to the next round; Akron's Chris Via, the No. 1 seed, is the defending champion; winner receives $30,000.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (14-9, 6-6) defeated the Wildcats, 69-63, on Jan. 14 behind 34 points and four assists from Ryan Conwell; Villanova (13-10, 6-6) is 10-3 at home this season behind Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 23.8 ppg.

programme.title: All Madden
programme.desc: John Madden made his impact felt in the football world through several different avenues, from becoming a Super Bowl winning coach with the Oakland Raiders to becoming a legendary commentator and influencing a video game franchise.

programme.title: 26th Annual Super Bowl Soulful Celebration
programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.desc: EJ Tackett, who looks to win his 25th career title and move into a tie with Brian Voss for 11th all-time, leads the tour in points through two events; Graham Fach won the season opener.

programme.desc: Oregon (16-7, 5-7) dropped its last four games, but is 8-3 away from home; No. 9 Michigan State (18-4, 9-2) lost two straight after a 13-game winning streak, but is 11-0 at home behind Jaden Akins, who leads the Spartans with 13.5 ppg.
